p: Mesenchymal stem cells (MSC) derived from bone marrow, adipose, or other sources can exert inhibitory effects on immune-mediated disease states [ 6– 10]. In particular, MSC derived from umbilical cord (UC) Wharton's Jelly possess a high proliferative and expansive ability, an enhanced therapeutic activity compared to other MSC [ 11– 14], and superior production of growth factors that stimulate secretions responsible for therapeutic potential [ 15].
